Dominant Derwent claim College Rugby 10s title

Derwent College cemented their place as college rugby's premier side, as they romped to a dominant victory in today's 10s tournament

Halifax back to winning ways

Halifax earned their first college football win of the year with a 2-0 triumph over Langwith on the 3G pitch this morning

Davies brace hands James victory

A brace of goals from James Davies gave James College a 2-0 victory over Alcuin on a brisk 22 Acres this morning

Tracking the Future

In the midst of the track cycling world championships, Beth Jakubowski looks ahead to Rio 2016 and who will be looking to book their place amongst a team of glittering Olympic champions

Women's rugby beaten by organised Sheffield

The women's rugby firsts fell to a hard defeat at the hands of a very well-drilled and organised Sheffield side today

York's footballers fall agonisingly short of cup final

York's women's footballers fell to an agonising defeat in their semi-final today. York played some impressive football with standout performances from Marte Wang and Maria Davies in particular

Women's fencing out in quarter finals

The women's fencing team were today knocked out of the BUCS Championship by an impressive Cardiff outfit

Hull claim Varsity trophy after shooting win

York's clay pigeon shooting club were unable to retain the Varsity trophy for York as they came up against one of the country's finest university shooting teams at Hull's regular shooting range near Scunthorpe

Women's badminton in Varsity rout

The sole badminton women's team at Varsity were able to replicate the score-line of the men's seconds team as they helped York earn three vital points in the tournament

Net cord gives men's badminton firsts draw

After drawing with Hull's firsts team twice already this season, the men's badminton firsts could only repeat the result for a third time at Varsity, courtesy of Andrew Henderson shot that happened to fall on the right side of the net cord and saved the White Rose at the last

Football seconds in dramatic Varsity win

York men's football seconds secured victory over home side Hull in dramatic fashion at Varsity 2013

Football fourths clash completes Varsity whitewash

Johnny Grout's fourths side rounded off a fantastic day at Varsity 2013 for York football by hammering their Humberside opponents in this fixture

Men's badminton seconds claim easy win

The badminton men's seconds team put valuable points on the table for York at Varsity as they cruised to a comprehensive victory as Hull struggled to put up a fight

Badminton thirds secure dominant win

An inspired men's thirds team gave their Hull equivalents a lesson in badminton as they brushed aside a disorganised opposition of little experience in Sunday's Varsity match

Varsity organisers under fire

The University of Hull's White Rose Varsity organisation has suffered a backlash following a series of scheduling and fixture mix ups on Sunday

Volleyball side cruise to Varsity victory

York's mixed volleyball team were comfortable winners on Sunday, securing a 3-0 victory to hand the visitors all three points on offer

Fantastic UYAFC stun nine-man Hull

The men's football firsts put in a breathtaking display of free flowing football to comeback from 2-1 down to win 5-2 against an aggressive Hull and complete a white wash of football wins in Sunday's White Rose Varsity

Men's lacrosse team thrash Hull in Varsity clash

York turned on the style as the men's lacrosse firsts thrashed Hull 17-0 in a very one sided Varsity fixture

Mann of the match display secures win for football thirds

Joe Mann put in a virtuoso performance and Tom Parish scored a brace as the men's football thirds came from behind to beat Hull in a thrilling Varsity clash

Women's lacrosse in stylish Varsity victory

In a tremendous all round performance, the women's lacrosse firsts came away from Varsity with a comfortable victory over a dogged Hull side

Men's basketball firsts suffer narrow Hull defeat

In a passionate encounter, York were undone by a poor second quarter as they succumbed to a 62-50 defeat at the hands of a good Hull side

James fall agonisingly short in Varsity match

James' first team women came close to securing a late comeback against Hull's netball thirds team, only to succumb to a narrow 23-26 defeat in Hull's Sports Center. In the end James simply did not have time to overturn a deficit which had been as large as seven goals at points in the match

Netball firsts brave performance ends in defeat

York's netball firsts turned in a brave performance at Varsity yesterday, despite playing a side two leagues above them Nina Pullman's team offered up a very solid performance that will undoubtedly hearten them going ahead with the season

Netball seconds win tense Varsity thriller

York's netball seconds pulled off a fantastic win at Varsity yesterday in what was an intense and aggressive encounter. Amidst a hostile Hull crowd, York were able to seal an impressive victory with a very solid all round team performance

Points shared in Varsity trampolining

In one of the day's final fixtures, York took three important points in the upper class of the trampolining, with Hull adding two points to their tally

Referee nightmare condemns York women's footballers to loss

Poor refereeing decisions and an under strength team condemned York's footballers to a 3-1 loss at Varsity today. Despite a goal from Rohanna Nilsson early in the second half, the referee's poor time keeping cost York a precious ten minutes in the second half

Netball thirds dominate Varsity match

York's netball thirds secured their Varsity point with ease yesterday as they steam-rollered Hull 42-12. There were some exceptional performances from captain Eliza Ackland and centre Becky Coomber who were in fine form as they helped their side to victory

Squash teams suffer Varsity defeat

An understrength York squash team succumbed to a double defeat against Hull in Sunday's Varsity clash, securing a crucial five points for the hosts

Robertson stars as women's rugby team dismantle physical Hull

The women's rugby firsts put in an impressive display to claim a 24-17 victory over a stubborn Hull side on Sunday in the 2013 White Rose Varsity, giving York a vital three points

York fencers open Varsity with a win

York's men's fencing team opened Sunday's Varsity proceedings with a commanding win thanks to some spectacular performances in the Sabre and Epee
